content: until it matches your first half - row 5 neckline granny cluster as normal to the blue dress 9 row after neckline decreases neckline of the dress…when you reach the green dress 13 row after neckline decreases neckline put an entire granny stitch in the last - row 7 chain 3 granny cluster in the next space and stitch to increase turn your work along the row to the end 2 double_crochet in the last stitch increasing at the end of a row turn your work - row 8 chain 3 granny cluster in the next space and to the end of the row 2 double_crochet in the last stitch back panel the back panel can be completed the same as the front panel increasing a granny stitch at the beginning of a row sleeves pay attention to how big you want your armholes to be the sleeves of this dress are worked along your arm instead of in the round they are made the same way as the front and back panels without the increases or decreases - make a chain from the edge of the sleeve you created to your wrist be sure that it is a multiple of 3 plus 2 for example…if you leave 8 cluster stitches for your sleeve width then each side of your sleeve should be about 16 row so to account for the other side the entire sleeve will be about 32 row - row 1 sleeve along your chain double_crochet in the third stitch from the hook skip 1 granny cluster in the next stitch skip 2 granny cluster * repeat to the end of the row 2 double_crochet in the last stitch turn your work - row 2 sleeve chain 3 granny cluster in the next space and along the row to the end 2 double_crochet in the last stitch turn your work either way make them as big as you desire them to be measure them along yourself - row 3 sleeve chain 3 granny cluster in the next space and to the end of the row 2 double_crochet in the last stitch repeat row 2 and 3 until your sleeve is large enough to fit around your arm comfortably border row… add a row of single_crochet stitches all the way around the dress especially at the neckline add this row to the sleeves and the bottom of the dress you can either stitch the sleeves together after they are complete or while you perform the last row see the below link for how stitching together your sleeve on the swiftie dress sample of how to stitch together the sleeves with no seam make 2 sleeves stitching together the dress… stitch together front and back panels leaving plenty of space for the sleeves add a row of single_crochet stitches to the inside of the sleeve if desired to make stitching them together easier stitch the sleeves to the armhole if you have a space at the neckline between granny
